Description: Book of the Dead of Men-[..]; sheet 6; Hieratic text; black line vignettes.
Curator's comments: Fragments of gold foil apparently from this papyrus are registered as EA 76470; fragments of papyrus as EA 76472; fragments of textile as EA 76473. Bibliography: Wüthrich, A., Édition synoptique et traduction des chapitres supplémentaires du Livre des Morts 162 à 167 (Studien zu Altägyptischen Totentexten 19,1, 2). Wiesbaden 2015.
See S. Quirke, 'The Last Books of the Dead?' in W. V. Davies (ed), Studies in Egyptian Antiquities: A Tribute to T. G. H. James (BM Occasional Paper 123, 1999), 83-98.

Mosher, Malcom Jr. 2016. The Book of the Dead, Saite through Ptolemaic periods : a study of traditions evident in versions of texts and vignettes (SPBD Studies), vol. I (BD Spells 1-15) and II (BD Spells 16, 18-30), Charleston.
Bibliographic references: Quirke 1993 / Owners of funerary papyri in the British Museum (111)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57041) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57041)
Vleeming 2015 / Demotic graffiti and other short texts gathered from many publications (no.1990, p.346)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: brittle, fragile, loss, stained Black ink Red ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape, masking tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
